{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:18.079

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:24.079

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:28.079
    | text      = Now that's a headline right there
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:31.079
    | text      = Apparently, Bergy had been employed as a computer network administrator, uh, for the Florida Heart and Vascular Associates Cardiology Clinic
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:38.079
    | text      = Bergy claims that he was fired for, quote, putting country before company, but the story doesn't seem so cut and dry
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:44.079
    | text      = His boss, Dr. Klein, themselves an Air Force veteran, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:48.079
    | text      = said Bergy stopped showing up for work shortly after he told Klein on October 3rd of his plan to join the military
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:54.079
    | text      = Huh
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:55.079
    | text      = He declined to comment further on Bergy's employment status and work history
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:58.079
    | text      = Wow, fair
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:59.079
    | text      = As part of the 1994 Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act, you cannot discriminate against an employee for enlisting
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:06.079
    | text      = And you're required to rehire returning enlisted persons after their active duty is over, so that would have been a problem
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:12.079
    | text      = However, according to this Times article, quote, in an October 18th letter Klein sent to Bergy, the doctor lauded him for his desire to serve his country
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:21.079
    | text      = and he, uh, and said he intended to comply with federal labor laws
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:25.079
    | text      = But Klein also said that Bergy had been, quote, repeatedly insubordinate, that he had rung up a $340 charge in unauthorized, uh, uh, charges on the company's phone

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:36.079
    | text      = and was unresponsive to reports of computer problems at the clinic
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:47.079
    | text      = Interestingly, just before deciding to enlist, Patrick Bergy had tried to enter the world of politics
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:53.079
    | text      = In the 2004 election, he ran for the office of Pasco County Supervisor of Elections in Florida
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:59.079
    | text      = An article about his campaign from the Tampa Bay Times comes off very strange
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:03.079
    | text      = Bergy seemed mad that his opponent, the sitting election supervisor, Kurt Browning, was getting free press by doing his job
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:09.079
    | text      = And appearing at public meetings about the upcoming elections that air on C-SPAN
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:13.079
    | text      = Sure
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:14.079
    | text      = Bergy saw Browning's appearances to discuss elections as a form of campaigning and was trying to demand equal time on those platforms for his campaign
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:22.079
    | text      = That's a swing, I like it
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:23.079
    | text      = It's a weird angle, but it seems also downright kick-sodic when you consider that from the jump he was running a doomed campaign
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:31.079
    | text      = From this Times article, quote
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:33.079
    | text      = One of Bergy's first acts upon getting into the race was the political equivalent of shooting oneself in the foot
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:38.079
    | text      = He decided to run without any party affiliation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:41.079
    | text      = Bergy didn't want anyone even considering that the would-be election supervisor might favor one party over the other
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:47.079
    | text      = He wanted to seize the moral high ground because he intended to slam Browning for his very public switch to the Republican Party in 2002
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:55.079
    | text      = In the eyes of many political observers, Bergy's decision was both commendable and politically suicidal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:01.079
    | text      = He effectively shut the door on any hope for organized support
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:05.079
    | text      = Though he obviously had, you know, a political identity
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:09.079
    | text      = And now is almost universally pictured wearing bikers for Trump vests
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:13.079
    | text      = Bergy went out of his way to self-defeating extremes in order to appear hyper neutral
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:19.079
